availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William P. Stubbs (Lyon County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier in 1st Ky Cav C.S.A)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Minerva Stubbs. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 1st Regiment Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a private beginning October 15, 1861. Discharge date unknown.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 326A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 680.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 506A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 516.
"Name (1835-unknown)," Find A Grave, Memorial #41612417, accessed November X, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41612417.
